sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Flora's lamentable passion, crown'd with unspeakable joy and comfort. Flora she did sore lament, her spirit did decay; Strephon fill'd her with content, and cast all grief away. To the tune of, Tender hearts of London city.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for J[onah]. Deacon, at the Angel in Guilt-spur street without Newgate., [London] : [1685?]
Verse: "Floras in her grove she lyed ..." Place, date of publication, and publisher's name from Wing. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
=======
